Key Match Events: Shota Imanaga gave up two runs in the first but allowed just three runs on four hits while striking out eight and walking just one in six innings
Pete Crow-Armstrong hit a two-RBI double
Cody Bellinger hit a two-run shot
Nate Pearson faced the minimum in two scoreless frames
Tyson Miller allowed three of four batters to reach in the ninth
Drew Smyly walked CJ Abrams and allowed a two-RBI single to Jacob Young
Keegan Thompson struck out Dylan Crews with a curveball to end the game
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs are enjoying one of their hottest stretches of the season, having won four straight and 10 of 13 games
Manager Craig Counsell emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
The Cubs' short bullpen pushed through the game despite the offense stalling after the second inning
Post-Match Reflections: Counsell highlighted the importance of the bullpen's performance in securing the win
Keegan Thompson was praised for coming in a tough spot and making tough pitches to end the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tyson Miller faced four batters from the left side in the ninth
Dylan Crews is one of the top prospects in baseball and hit two homers in the last few days
Shawn Armstrong was picked up by the Cubs to provide bullpen reinforcement
Porter Hodge was down after throwing 36 pitches in two days
